item.description: CMD-ONE 1.0.0 (CMD for OpenNebula) is the first major release of the Cloud Middleware Distribution, targeted for use with OpenNebula 5. It contains packages for CentOS7 only.
item.releaseNotes: This release contains the following products:<ul><li>oneacct 0.4.6-1 - tool for exporting accounting data from OpenNebula into APEL</li><li>rOCCI-server -&nbsp;&nbsp; A server implementation of the Open Cloud Computing Interface</li><li>APEL-SSM - Secure STOMP Messenger</li><li>cloudkeeper -&nbsp; A tool to synchronize cloud appliances between AppDB and cloud platforms </li><li>cloudkeeper-one - OpenNebula backend for cloudkeeper</li><li>gridsite -&nbsp; set of extensions to the Apache web server and a toolkit for Grid credentials, GACL access control lists and HTTP(S) protocol operations</li><li>cloud-bdii-infoprovider - generates a representation of cloud resources, that can be published inside a BDII or any other component like the INDIGO Configuration Management Database (CMDB)</li><li>rOCCI-client -&nbsp; A client implementation of the Open Cloud Computing Interface</li></ul>
item.installationNotes: All products in CMD-ONE 1.0.0 were verified against EGI's current Quality Criteria. Installation and configuration notes are available in the EGI repository.
item.contact: For further information about the distribution, its goals and surrounding processes, and more information about how to engage as a Technology Provider with EGI, please send an Email to: cto (at) egi.eu.
item.technicalContact: For any bugs and issues you encounter that are not described in the release notes of this release, or the related documentation provided by the Technology Providers, please visit the EGI Helpdesk (https://ggus.eu/) to make a report.
item.knownIssues: The version of rOCCI-server shipped with this CMD-ONE release (1.1.9) still requires <a href="https://github.com/EGI-FCTF/fctf-perun">Perun scripts for FedCloud</a> to be installed manually. In the future this integration will no longer be supported, and as a consequence the corresponding versions of rOCCI-server will no longer need these script. Also, please visit https://wiki.egi.eu/wiki/CMD-ONE-1:CMD-ONE-1.0.0 for more details on known issues.
item.changeLog: This is the first version of the first major release of CMD-ONE (CMD for OpenNebula 5).

item.description: CMD-OS 1.3.0 (CMD for OpenStack) is an update of the Cloud Middleware Distribution targeted for use with OpenStack. It includes updates for CentOS7 and Ubuntu.
item.releaseNotes: This release contains the following products and updates for CentOS7 and Ubuntu: <ul><li>APEL-SSM 2.3.0 - improvements, see <a href="https://github.com/apel/ssm/blob/dev/CHANGELOG">https://github.com/apel/ssm/blob/dev/CHANGELOG</a></li><li>cloud-info-provider 0.12.0 - improvements and bug fixes <a href="https://github.com/EGI-Foundation/cloud-info-provider/releases/tag/0.12.0">https://github.com/EGI-Foundation/cloud-info-provider/releases/tag/0.12.0</a></li><li>cASO 1.4.0 - fix for negative values duration bug, plus other fixes and improvements <a href="https://appdb.egi.eu/store/software/caso/releases/1.x/1.4.0/">https://appdb.egi.eu/store/software/caso/releases/1.x/1.4.0/</a></li></ul>Only on CentOS7: <ul><li>APEL 1.8.1 - added option to update benchmarks/spec levels using a local configuration option rather than the BDII</li></ul>
item.installationNotes: All products in CMD-OS 1.3.0 were verified against EGI's current Quality Criteria. Installation and configuration notes are available in the EGI repository.

item.description: CMD-OS 1.2.1 (CMD for OpenStack) is an fix release of the Cloud Middleware Distribution. It includes a fix for cloudkeeper-os for CentOS7, and a new release of cASO for CentOS7 and Ubuntu.
item.releaseNotes: <ul><li>cloudkeeper-os 0.9.10 - fix dependency issue on CentOS7 (only)</li><li>cASO 1.2.0 - a bug was introduced in how records are retrieved with the introduction of the the "deleted" filter; this release fixes the bug, sites will need to regenerate accounting records; see cASO release notes for more details</li></ul>
item.installationNotes: All products in CMD-OS 1.2.1 were verified against EGI's current Quality Criteria. Installation and configuration notes are available in the EGI repository.

item.description: CMD-OS 1.2.0 (CMD for OpenStack) is a minor update of the Cloud Middleware Distribution. This release includes updates for use with OpenStack Mitaka and above, on CentOS7 and Ubuntu 16 (Xenial).
item.releaseNotes: This update includes the following products for CentOS7 and Ubuntu 16: <ul><li>cloudkeeper 1.6.0 (NEW) - Cloudkeeper checks the EGI App DB for new or updated images that need to be supported on the site. It downloads images and registers them with OpenNebula, so that they can be used in resource instantiation.</li><li>cloudkeeper-os 0.9.9 (NEW) - Cloudkeeper-os is able to manage OpenStack cloud - upload, update and remove images and templates representing EGI AppDB appliances. cloudkeeper-os runs as a server listening for gRPC communication usually from core cloudkeeper component.</li><li>cloud-info-provider 0.9.1 - makes OCCI optional, avoiding failures if no OCCI endpoint is configured; updates on documentation, now stored on a dedicated EGI Foundation github store</li></ul>
item.installationNotes: All products in CMD-OS 1.2.0 were verified against EGI's current Quality Criteria. Installation and configuration notes are available in the EGI repository.

item.description: CMD-OS 1.1.3 (CMD for OpenStack) is a revision of the Cloud Middleware Distribution, targeted for use with OpenStack Mitaka.It contains updates for CentOS7 and Ubuntu Xenial.
item.releaseNotes:
This release contains the following:<ul><li>cASO - pluggable extractor of Cloud Accounting Usage Records from an OpenStack 
installation; please carefully read <a href="https://appdb.egi.eu/store/software/caso/releases/1.x/1.1.0/">these release notes</a> if you are upgrading</li><li>cloud-info-provider - generates a representation of cloud resources, that can be published inside a BDII or any other component like the INDIGO Configuration Management Database (CMDB); further details in the <a href="https://appdb.egi.eu/store/software/cloud.info.provider/releases/0.x/0.8.3/">release notes</a></li><li>ooi - an implementation the Open Grid Forum Open Cloud Computing Interface (OCCI) for OpenStack. This is a bugfix release, see complete list of bug fixes <a href="https://launchpad.net/ooi/+milestone/1.1.2">here</a></li></ul>

item.knownIssues:
<b>This update needs a fix for the CentOS7 part (Xenial not affected): a CERN RDO mirror must be configured on the host, as the main RDO is not available any more. </b>Please run the following for the CentOS7 version of CMD-OS: <blockquote><i># yum install 
http://linuxsoft.cern.ch/cern/centos/7/cloud/x86_64/openstack-mitaka/centos-release-openstack-mitaka-1-5.el7.noarch.rpm</i></blockquote>Please visit https://wiki.egi.eu/wiki/CMD-OS-1:CMD-OS-1.1.3 for known issues.

item.description: The UMD 4.9.1 is an update release of UMD 4. It includes dCache 5.2.10 and CVMFS 2.6.3 for CentOS7 and SL6. It also contains HTCondor 8.8.1, HTCondor-CE 3.2.1for CentOS7.  WARNING: HTCondor and HTCondor-CE have been released in UMD 4.9.1 pointing to the original documentation and without providing EGI-specific installation and configuration guides.
item.releaseNotes:
This release contains the following products and updates for CentOS7 and SL6: <ul><li>dCache 5.2.10 - various bug fixes and improvements https://www.dcache.org/downloads/1.9/release-notes-5.2.shtml</li><li>CVMFS 2.6.3 - patch release. It fixes parsing of the /etc/hosts file for several corner cases </li></ul>This release contains also the following products for CentOS7:<ul><li>HTCondor 8.8.1 - HTCondor is a specialized workload management 
system for compute-intensive jobs. With this release of UMD, this 
version is included for the first time. Please refer to the HTCondor 
documentation for further details on this product: 
https://research.cs.wisc.edu/htcondor/manual/</li><li>HTCondor-CE 3.2.1 -
 The HTCondor-CE software is a job gateway based on HTCondor for Compute
 Elements (CE) belonging to a computing grid. Please refer to the 
HTCondor-CE documentation for further details on this product: 
https://htcondor-ce.readthedocs.io/en/stable/</li></ul>

WARNING: HTCondor and HTCondor-CE have been released in UMD 4.9.1 pointing to the original documentation and without providing EGI-specific installation and configuration guides.

item.description: UMD 4.8.3 is an update of the fourth Major release of UMD. It includes updates for CentOS7 and SL6.

item.description: UMD 4.8.0 is a regular update of the fourth Major release of UMD. It add updates for CentOS7 and SL6.
item.releaseNotes:
This release contains the following products and updates for CentOS7 and SL6:
<ul><li>APEL-SSM 2.3.0 - several new features, among which Ubuntu support and Ipv6 support, see the <a href="https://github.com/apel/ssm/releases">release notes</a></li><li>XRootD 4.8.4 - major bug fixes and improvements, see the <a href="http://xrootd.org/2018/07/06/announcement_4_8_4.html">release notes</a></li><li>CernVM-FS 2.5.1 - bugfixes and improvements for clients, stratum 0 and stratum 1 servers; support for Ubuntu Bionic. See <a href="https://cvmfs.readthedocs.io/en/2.5/cpt-releasenotes.html">release notes</a>&nbsp;</li><li>CERN Frontier squid 3.5.28-3.1 - see <a href="http://frontier.cern.ch/dist/rpms-debug/frontier-squidRELEASE_NOTES">release notes</a>&nbsp;</li><li>DPM 1.10.4 - several improvements and bug fixes, see <a href="http://lcgdm.web.cern.ch/dpm-1104-epel-testing">release notes</a>&nbsp;</li><li>Dynafed 1.3.2 - improvements and bug fixes in the <a href="http://lcgdm.web.cern.ch/dynafed-132-released-epel">change log</a>&nbsp;</li><li>BDII 5.2.25 - several <a href="https://github.com/EGI-Foundation/bdii/releases">fixes</a>&nbsp;</li><li>glite-info-update-endpoint 3.0.1 - updated in particular to drop OSG support, see <a href="https://github.com/EGI-Foundation/glite-info-update-endpoints/releases">release notes</a></li><li>GRAM5 14.1.0, GridFTP 13.8.1 - <a href="https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2018-8aebaba2a9">bug fixes</a></li></ul>

item.description: UMD 4.7.1 is an emergency fix release of the fourth Major release of UMD. item.description: UMD 4.7.0 is a regular update of the fourth Major release of UMD. It contains updated packages for CentOS7 and SL6.
item.releaseNotes: This release contains the following updates: <h3>CentOS7</h3><ul><li>davix 0.6.7 - various improvements and bug fixes, see release notes http://dmc.web.cern.ch/release/davix-067</li><li>ARC 15.03.18 - bugfix release, addressing 3 bugs discovered since release 15.03u17, see release notes http://www.nordugrid.org/arc/releases/15.03u18/release_notes_15.03u18.html</li><li>APEL 1.6.2-1 - various bug fixes, see release notes https://github.com/apel/apel/releases/tag/1.6.2-1</li><li>APEL-SSM 2.2.1 - Added a check that certificates have not expired before starting SSM. SSL errors now propagated out properly and saved for received messages. Trimmed down the number of log messages generated for receivers. Added python-devel build requirement for non fedora-packager OSs (CentOS). </li><li>gfal2 2.15.4 - various bug fixes, see release notes https://dmc.web.cern.ch/release/gfal2-2154</li><li>srm-ifce 1.24.3 - various bug fixes, se release notes http://dmc.web.cern.ch/release/srm-ifce-1.24.3</li><li>FTS 3 7.8 - several bug fixes and improvements https://fts.web.cern.ch/sites/fts.web.cern.ch/themes/fts-webpage/releases-jekyll/releases/2018/01/30/FTS_3_7_8/</li><li>XROOTD 4.8.2 - several bug fixes and improvements https://github.com/xrootd/xrootd/blob/v4.8.2/docs/ReleaseNotes.txt</li><li>dCache 3.2.21 - several bug fixes and improvements https://www.dcache.org/downloads/1.9/release-notes-3.2.shtml#21</li><li>VOMS clients 3.3.0 - see release notes http://italiangrid.github.io/voms/release-notes/voms-clients/3.0.7/</li><li>MyProxy 6.1.29 - Fix -Werror=format-security errors </li><li>CERN Frontier squid 3.5.27-4.1 - see release notes </li><li>CernVM-FS server 2.5.0 - see release notes https://cvmfs.readthedocs.io/en/2.5/cpt-releasenotes.html</li><li>yaim-core 5.1.6 - This release provides a backward compatible fix for GT4_INSTALL script name change and for the broken "join" command on CentOS/EL 7. Aslo added recognition of CentOS/SL/EL 7</li><li>globus gridftp 12.5.1</li></ul><h3>SL6</h3><ul><li>davix 0.6.7 - various improvements and bug fixes, see release notes http://dmc.web.cern.ch/release/davix-067</li><li>ARC 15.03.18 - bugfix release, addressing 3 bugs discovered since release 15.03u17, see release notes http://www.nordugrid.org/arc/releases/15.03u18/release_notes_15.03u18.html</li><li>APEL 1.6.2-1 - various bug fixes, see release notes https://github.com/apel/apel/releases/tag/1.6.2-1</li><li>APEL-SSM 2.2.1 - Added a check that certificates have not expired before starting SSM. SSL errors now propagated out properly and saved for received messages. Trimmed down the number of log messages generated for receivers. Added python-devel build requirement for non fedora-packager OSs (CentOS). </li><li>gfal2 2.15.4 - various bug fixes, see release notes https://dmc.web.cern.ch/release/gfal2-2154</li><li>srm-ifce 1.24.3 - various bug fixes, se release notes http://dmc.web.cern.ch/release/srm-ifce-1.24.3</li><li>FTS 3 7.8 - several bug fixes and improvements https://fts.web.cern.ch/sites/fts.web.cern.ch/themes/fts-webpage/releases-jekyll/releases/2018/01/30/FTS_3_7_8/</li><li>StoRM 1.11.13 - fixes to some outstanding bugs, see details in the release notes http://italiangrid.github.io/storm/2018/02/19/storm-v1.11.13-released.html</li><li>XROOTD 4.8.2 - several bug fixes and improvements https://github.com/xrootd/xrootd/blob/v4.8.2/docs/ReleaseNotes.txt</li><li>dCache 3.2.21 - several bug fixes and improvements https://www.dcache.org/downloads/1.9/release-notes-3.2.shtml#21</li><li>MyProxy 6.1.29 - Fix -Werror=format-security errors </li><li>VOMS clients 3.3.0 - see release notes http://italiangrid.github.io/voms/release-notes/voms-clients/3.0.7/</li><li>yaim-core 5.1.6 - Fixed CentOS 6 line </li><li>CERN Frontier squid 3.5.27-4.1 - see release notes </li><li>CernVM-FS server 2.5.0 - see release notes https://cvmfs.readthedocs.io/en/2.5/cpt-releasenotes.html</li><li>globus gridftp 12.5.1</li><li>canl 2.5.0</li><li>bouncycastle 1.58-1</li></ul>

item.description: UMD 4.6.1 is a revision of the fourth Major release of UMD. It contains updated packages for CentOS7 and SL6.
item.releaseNotes: This release contains the following product updates, both for CentOS7 and SL6: <ul><li>APEL-SSM 2.2.0 - Added a check that certificates have not expired before starting SSM. SSL errors now propagated out properly and saved for received messages. Trimmed down the number of log messages generated for receivers. Added python-devel build requirement for non fedora-packager OSs (CentOS)</li><li>DPM 1.9.2 - This update includes releases 1.9.2 and lcgdm 0.19.0. It contains a fix for dpm-listspaces wrongly reporting 0 free space for pools See http://lcgdm.web.cern.ch/dpm-192-release</li><li>XRootD 4.7.1 - various bug fixes https://github.com/xrootd/xrootd/blob/v4.7.1/docs/ReleaseNotes.txt</li><li>CVMFS server 2.4.4 - fix registration of chunk hashes without bulk hash and non-SHA1 hash algorithm: fix on geoapi. See http://cvmfs.readthedocs.io/en/2.4/cpt-releasenotes.html</li><li>CVMFS 2.4.4 - react to a change of DNS server on macOS. See http://cvmfs.readthedocs.io/en/2.4/cpt-releasenotes.html</li><li>APEL 1.6.1 - various fixes and improvements https://github.com/apel/apel/releases/tag/1.6.1-1</li><li>frontier-squid 3.5.27-3.1 - includes an important configuration change to enable frontier clients to clear out certain types of cached errors</li></ul>

item.description: UMD 4.2.1 is a revision update of the fourth Major release of UMD. It contains updates both for SL6 and CentOS7.
item.releaseNotes: This release contains the following products: *** SL6 and CentOS7* Credential managementGrisite 2.3.2canL 2.1.7***PLEASE READ CAREFULLY***A known issue has been reported by WLCG with canL upgrade on SL6 shipped with this release. canL 2.1.7 triggers an openssl upgrade to openssl-1.0.1e, which can conflict with the dracut-fips package. The dracut-fips package is not part of UMD, but it can come installed with the base system, although it is not often the case. The UMD team recommends to remove the dracut-fips package if not needed by the base system, right before upgrading to canL 2.1.7. In case you need dracut-fips instead, please contact the EGI Software Provisioning SU through GGUS to get support to resolve the conflict.

item.description: The UMD 4.11.0 is a regular release of the UMD 4 release. It includes several updates for CentOS7 and SL6.
item.releaseNotes:
This release contains includes several updates for CentOS7 and SL6.

* APEL-SSM 2.4.1 - Secure Stomp Messenger (SSM) updated - Added a delay when receiver is reconnecting to improve reliability. Improved the log output for SSM receivers so that there are fewer trivial entries and so it's more useful in tracking messages on the filesystem.
* argo-ams-library 0.5.1 - included in UMD
* cvmfs 2.7.2 - CernVM File System (CernVM-FS) 2.7.2 is a patch release. It contains bugfixes and improvements for clients and servers. See https://cvmfs.readthedocs.io/en/2.7/cpt-releasenotes.html
* CERN Frontier 4.11-3.1 - includes a patch and some fixes http://frontier.cern.ch/dist/rpms-debug/frontier-squidRELEASE_NOTES
* FTS3 3.9.4 - includes bug fixes and improvements https://fts.web.cern.ch/sites/fts.web.cern.ch/themes/fts-webpage/releases-jekyll/releases/2020/05/07/FTS_3_9_4/
* dCache 5.2.20 - some fixes and improvements https://www.dcache.org/old/downloads/1.9/release-notes-5.2.shtml#20
item.installationNotes: All products in UMD 4.11.0 were verified against EGI's current Quality Criteria. Installation and configuration notes are available in the EGI repository.
item.contact: For further information about the distribution, its goals and surrounding processes, and more information about how to engage as a Technology Provider with EGI, please send an Email to: operations (at) egi.eu.
item.technicalContact: For any bugs and issues you encounter that are not described in the release notes of this release, or the related documentation provided by the Technology Providers, please visit the EGI Helpdesk (https://ggus.eu/) to make a report.
item.knownIssues: Please visit https://wiki.egi.eu/wiki/UMD-4:UMD-4.11.0 for known issues.
item.changeLog:
This release contains includes several updates for CentOS7 and SL6.

* APEL-SSM 2.4.1 - Secure Stomp Messenger (SSM) updated - Added a delay when receiver is reconnecting to improve reliability. Improved the log output for SSM receivers so that there are fewer trivial entries and so it's more useful in tracking messages on the filesystem.
* argo-ams-library 0.5.1 - included in UMD
* cvmfs 2.7.2 - CernVM File System (CernVM-FS) 2.7.2 is a patch release. It contains bugfixes and improvements for clients and servers. See https://cvmfs.readthedocs.io/en/2.7/cpt-releasenotes.html
* CERN Frontier 4.11-3.1 - includes a patch and some fixes http://frontier.cern.ch/dist/rpms-debug/frontier-squidRELEASE_NOTES
* FTS3 3.9.4 - includes bug fixes and improvements https://fts.web.cern.ch/sites/fts.web.cern.ch/themes/fts-webpage/releases-jekyll/releases/2020/05/07/FTS_3_9_4/

item.description: UMD 3.9.0 is the ninth update of the third Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release contains support for both Scientific Linux 5 and 6 and also Debian 6 (Squeeze).
item.releaseNotes:
This release contains the following products:Accounting<ul><li><b>APEL, v. 1.2.2</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This update fixes the issue of the client being unable to parse uncompressed accounting logs.</li></ul></ul>Authorization<ul><li><b>DPM-argus plugin, v. 1.8.8</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This release provides a little packaging fix to <strong>dpm-argus</strong> to make it work 
across EPEL and EMI, through different release numbers. dpm-argus now 
will work with any dpm-mysql-nameserver whose version is greater than 
1.8.7.</li><li> The fix also adds to the dpm-argus package the 
dpns-arguspoll manpage, which was left behind by mistake in the recent 
release of this component.</li></ul></ul>Client Tools<ul><li><b>dCache srmclient 2.2.27</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This release fixes the export SRM_PATH bug in srmrmdir and the ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException when processing multiple surls invoking srmget.</li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>EMI UI, v. 3.1.0</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This is a repacking release just to add the new dependencies on gfal2-util &amp; ginfo.</li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>GFAL2-util, v. 1.0.0</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>First
 release in UMD of the GFAL 2 util which is a group of command line 
tools for file manipulations with any protocol managed by gfal 2.0</li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>SRM-ifce, v. 1.20.0</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>Minor
 release in order to solve some bug fix like the excessive cpu usage 
from srm-ifce function or the Initialize time fields when 
stating/listing.</li></ul></ul>Credential management<ul><li><b>MyProxy, v. 5.9.8-2</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>First
 release in UMD-3 of the popular MyProxy from Globus which allows to 
manage&nbsp; X.509 Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) security credentials 
(certificates and private keys).</li></ul></ul>Data Acces<ul><li><b>DAVIX, v. 0.3.6</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This is a bug fix release which solves, among others, the OpenSSL issue with davix cmd line tools and password shell.</li></ul></ul>Information Discovery, Information Model<ul><li><b>BDII-core, v. 1.6.1</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This is a minor release containing a set of new features and minor fixes to the 
following packages: bdii, glue-validator, glue-schema and 
glite-info-provider-service.
		</li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>QCG Broker EGI IS provider, v. 3.4.0</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>Initial version of Information Provider for GLUE 1.3 and GLUE 2.0</li></ul></ul>File Access<ul><li><b>CVMFS, v. 2.1.19</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This
 is the first release in UMD of the client of the CernVM File System 
which is a network file system based on HTTP and optimized to deliver 
experiment software in a fast, scalable, and reliable way.</li></ul></ul>File Access, File Transfer, Storage Management<ul><li><b>dCache server, v. 2.6.35</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This release provides:</li><ul><li>fixes
 affecting multiple services: - The nfs and srm both cache replies from 
gPlazma to increase the speed of authenticating and identifying the 
user. Previously transient errors when communicating with gPlazma were 
also cached, delaying the recovery time from such errors. Now, such 
errors are not cached.</li><li>NFS - No longer trigger an NullPointerException when opening the .(parent)() dot-command file in Chimera's root directory.</li><li>POOL
 - Fix xrootd support for vector read. The problem was discovered with 
ROOT v6, which reports errors like Single readv transfer is too large.</li></ul><ul><li>XROOTD
 - Fix problems when calculating a response to the kXR_set request. If 
encountered, the problem results in the following being logged, where 
nnn in xrootd-disk-nnn is some integer number: 'Uncaught exception in 
thread xrootd-disk-nnn java.lang.IllegalStateException: null'</li></ul></ul></ul>Job Execution, Job Scheduling<ul><li><b>ARC, v. 13.11.2</b>, versions for SL5, SL6 and Debian</li><ul><li>This update contains changes to the following component versions.</li><ul><li>Nordugrid ARC to 4.2.0</li><li>Nordugrid ARC doc to 1.5.0</li><li>Nagios probes for ARC CE to 1.8.1</li></ul><li>There have been several bugfixes and updates with this version, more details in the release notes:
<a href="http://www.nordugrid.org/arc/releases/13.11u2/release_notes_13.11u2.html">http://www.nordugrid.org/arc/releases/13.11u2/release_notes_13.11u2.html</a></li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>CREAM SLURM module,v. 1.0.2</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This release provides a bug fix in the info-dynamic-scheduler-slurm namely SLURM provider should publish undefined values and missing check in triggerun</li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>CREAM LSF module</b>,&nbsp; v. 2.0.4, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This release provides multiple bugfix afecting the info-dynamic-scheduler and also an improved Glue2 support</li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>EMI WN, v. 3.1.0</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This is a repacking release just to add the new dependencies on gfal2-util &amp; ginfo.</li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>QCG Compute, v. 2.4.0</b>, versions for SL5:</li><ul><li>This is a minor release which introduce some bug fix and Updated the Java SDK to use JGlobus 2.0.8 it also introduces a new package for application scripts.</li></ul></ul>Job Scheduling<ul><li><b>QCG Broker, v. 3.4.0</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This
 release provides a new release for both the broker and the client and 
among several bugfix it provides support for parameter sweep jobs, new 
resource filters and improvements in data transfers.</li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>WMS, v. 3.6.6</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This
 is a bug fix release which provides a fix for the case were the WMProxy
 deletes a user delegated proxy on list-match operation and for the case
 were a CE can cause WMS to become very slow dealing with all other 
jobs. This release also contains a new version of the WMS UI which 
solves the issue of setting umask 0077 leading ot the issue that the 
sandbox was not writable by the WMS.</li></ul></ul>Messaging<ul><li><b>QCG Notifier, v. 3.4.0</b>, versions for SL5:</li><ul><li>This is a minor which introduce some bug fixes and also Disable the KEEP_ALIVE flag for the anonymous and SSL publishers.</li></ul></ul>Parallel Job:<ul><li><b>MPI, v. 1.5.3</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This is an update release of mpi-start 1.x series that fixes the following issue:<a href="https://github.com/IFCA/mpi-start/issues/12"> #12</a> - Wrong order in the list of hosts</li></ul></ul>Other<ul><li><b>caNl, v. 2.2.4</b>, versions for SL5, SL6 and Debian, containing:</li><ul><li><b>canl-c, v. 2.1.5:</b></li><ul><li id="aui_3_2_0_1199"> This revision fixes long-discussed certificate chain validation errors.</li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>canl-java, v. 1.3.3</b>:</li><ul><li>This update solves two closely related bugfixes of OCSP handling:
		</li><ul><li> failing OCSP responders are now cached (up to now only responses were cached)</li><li> the memory consumed by the in-memory cache of OCSP is now limited (was unconstrained).</li></ul></ul></ul></ul><ul><li><b>CGSI-gSOAP, v. 1.3.6</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This update fixes:</li><ul><li><a href="https://its.cern.ch/jira/issues/LCGUTIL-55">[LCGUTIL-55]</a> - API to set/get at runtime the different possible credentials</li><li><a href="https://its.cern.ch/jira/issues/LCGUTIL-384">[LCGUTIL-384]</a> - Remove compilation warnings on cgsi-gsoap</li><li><a href="https://its.cern.ch/jira/issues/LCGUTIL-430">[LCGUTIL-430]</a>&nbsp;- Disable weak ciphers</li></ul></ul></ul><ul><li><b>GFAL2, v. 2.6.8</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This release presents several new functionalities and improvements among several bug fixes. Now Gfal2&nbsp; provides xrootd and http supports as well as support for dCache.</li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>GFAL2-python, v. 1.5.0,</b> versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>Minor release which adds a buffer size parameter to the gfal-cp command and solves the issue of the Python bindings do not expose create parent option for copies.</li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>gfalFS, v. 1.5.0</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This is a minor release which introduces a bug fix for the du command in mounted file system reporting&nbsp; 0 for each file.</li></ul></ul>

item.description: UMD 3.8.0 is the eighth update of the third Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release contains support for both Scientific Linux 5 and 6 and also Debian 6 (Squeeze).
item.releaseNotes: This release contains the following products:File Transfer:<ul><li><b>dCache</b> v. 2.6.28, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This release provides an update of jblobus version which improves the error reporting together with a fix for the cases were the DN in certificates was not handled correctly. This version also provides a fix for the words-by-accent bug affecting the info-provider and a new xrootd back-port door.</li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>STORM</b> v. 1.11.4, versions for Sl5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This release provides several bug fixes namely at the WebDAV service responds on the /webdav/[storage-area] path. Also now the token used to secure all communication among the storm-frontend and gridhttps services and the backend is configured using the STORM_BE_XMLRPC_TOKEN YAIM variable.</li></ul></ul>Job execution:<ul><li><b>CREAM</b> v.1.16.3, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This is a bug fix release which among other fixes solves the issue with the typo in the CREAMCE yaim config_canl_java_tomcat, handles the continuous configuration reload that occurs if triggers are defined and also avoid to log the full stack trace.</li></ul></ul>Job Scheduling:<ul><li><b>WMS</b> v. 3.6.5, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This is a bug fix release providing a fix for the case were the glite_wms_wmproxy_load_monitor does not check ICE jobdir and for the glite-wms-job-info -p triggers which triggered a bug in the WMProxy. Also a change was made in yaim which now provides a WMS optimization in the my.cnf configuration file.</li></ul></ul>Other:<ul><li><b>DPM-DSI</b> v. 1.9.3-3, versions for Sl5 and SL6</li><ul><li>This release fixes an issue with transfers managed by FTS2, "EOF is not detected at block boundary". FTS3 transfers are not affected by the bug.</li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>GFAL2</b> v. 2.5.5, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This release present several functionalities like implement lfc logic that allows third party copy logic with SRM or the the implementation in gsiftp of meta-data cache. Also several bug fixes are provided like the problem with dates in gfalFS or the fact that when using an invalid proxy no error message was displayed. </li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>GridSite</b> v. 2.2.5, versions for SL5, SL6 and Debian:</li><ul><li>This is a revision release providing a fix to the memory handling issues, mostly around GRSTx509MakeProxyCert(), and incorporating a community fix for the htproxyput utility.</li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>L&amp;B</b> v. 4.1.2, versions for SL5, SL6 and Debian</li><ul><li>This release provides extended support for sites wishing to move the L&amp;B Server's database to a remote DB server (improved support for connection strings in config), moves the location of the L&amp;B Client JAR file to comply with Fedora/EPEL packaging rules, fixes build on the Power PC platform, updates packaging to comply with DH7 packaging standards, and makes sure zombie jobs are properly recognized and reported over L&amp;B server's http interface (i.e., when a JobID is used as an URL in a Web browser). It also provides a fix for n issues discovered in the 4.1.1 version.</li></ul></ul>

item.description: UMD 3.5.0 is the fifth update of the third Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release contains support for both Scientific Linux 5 and 6 and also Debian 6 (Squeeze).
item.releaseNotes: This release contains the following products:Accounting:APEL SSM 2.2.1 released in SL5 and SL6:<ul><li>This is a minor released which changes the behavior of the start and abort a transaction and raise exception when not connected during send_all.</li></ul>Storage Management:Storm 1.11.3 released in SL5 and SL6:<ul><li>This release provides fixes for security vulnerabilities that were recently reported, and several bug fixes namely at the level of the webdav service.</li></ul>Credential Management:ProxyRenewal v. 1.3.35 released in SL5 and SL6:<ul><li>This is a revision for ProxyRenewal, which makes sure 1024-bit keys are explicitly requested from Globus, overriding the current Globus default of 512 bits.&nbsp;</li></ul>Authorization:Globus GSISSH v. 5.3.10 released SL6:<ul><li>This release it incorporate changes from the standard openssh package and its now SHA-2 compliant.&nbsp;</li></ul>Information Model:LB 4.0.12-1 released in both SL5 and SL6:<ul><li>This is a maintenance release of L&amp;B which provides some fixes for packaging, rare memory handling issues, permissions for integration with CREAM, and improvements in the reliability of the Site Notification Keeper.</li></ul>Job Scheduling:QCG BROKER v. 3.2.0 released in SL5 and SL6:<ul><li>This release provides support for SHA2 certificates together with support for iRODS, http transfer and an extension in GetFactoryAttributes method in order to support SLURM. There also an enhancement of the support for parallel and multi-scale applications.</li></ul>Other:Dpm-Yaim v. 4.2.17 released in both sl5 and sl6:<ul><li>This is a maintenance release to address some specific problems related with dpm-xroot and dav filesystem configuration.&nbsp;</li></ul>GridSite v. 2.2.1 release in both Sl5 and SL6:<ul><li>This is a revision of GridSite, turning off server-side TLS tickets support, which has been turned on by default since OpenSSL 1.0.&nbsp;</li></ul>APEL PARSER &nbsp;v. 2.2.1 released in SL5 and SL6:<ul><li>This is a minor release which introduces some small tuning like the catch for xml parser exceptions to fix db loader crash or the way SLURM parser handles the time unit prefixes.&nbsp;</li></ul>BLAH v. 1.20.4 released in Sl5 and Sl6:<ul><li>This released provides a fix for the MPI support for SLURM jobs.</li></ul>CanL v. 2.2.1 released in SL5, SL6 and debian:<ul><li>This revision contains library dependencies cleanups, warnings fixes, and improved packaging together with &nbsp;bug-fix, related to key usage extension value in proxy certificates created with the library.</li></ul>

item.description: UMD 3.3.0 is the third update of the third Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release contains support for both Scientific Linux 5 and 6 and also Debian 6 (Squeeze).
item.releaseNotes: This release contains the following products:<b>EMI Technology Provider:Job Execution</b>Job Execution:CREAM 1.16.2 released in SL5 and SL6:<ul><li>This release provides some bugfixes name to the need of services restart after configuring with yaim.</li></ul>CREAM TORQUE module, v. 2.1.1 released in SL5 and SL6:<ul><li>This release provides a fix for the Wrong time format for MaxWallClockTime and Bad timezone format.</li></ul>ARC-CE v. 3.0.3 released in SL5 and SL6:<ul><li>This is a bug fix release, addressing problems with the ARC data tools and dCache HTTPS in addition to a backlog of older minor bugfixes.</li></ul>BLAH v. 1.20.3 released in Sl5 and Sl6:<ul><li>Fixed the sge_local_submit_attributes.sh problem with memory requirements.</li></ul>Job Scheduling:GridWay v. 5.14.1 released in Sl5, Sl6 and debian:<ul><li>This is a revision release in order to resolve file conflicts between packages.</li></ul>Client tools:UNICORE HILA v. 2.4.1 released in SL5, SL6 and debian:<ul><li>This is a minor release but it introduces a backward incompatibility with previous versions. This version among several bug fixes it also provides support for EMI_authlib, &nbsp;service discovery through EMIR and a new improved EMI-ES support interoperable with EMI-ES implementations of ARC, CREAM, and UNICORE.</li></ul>CanL v. 2.1.4 released in SL5, SL6 and debian:<ul><li>This is a hotfix for a bug whereby the type of proxy to sign whas erroneously hard-coded to a single value for different types of proxies, most importantly affecting RFC proxies.</li></ul>Storage management:DPM v. 1.8.7-3 released in SL5 and SL6:<ul><li>This release among several bug fixes introduces the database connection pooling. This release also contains important enhancements for DAV and the dpm-xrootd which now uses the DMLITE library .</li></ul>Information System:BDII-CORE v. 1.5.4 released both in SL5 and SL6:<ul><li>New version of glue-validator that will be validated by EGI for integration with the production Nagios infrastructure.&nbsp;</li></ul>BDII-TOP v. 1.1.3&nbsp;<ul><li>New version containing a bug fix in the ldap information provider that was preventing to publish some sites when the top BDII was performing slowly. The release also contains a minor fix in the glite-info-plugin-delayed-delete-status plugin.</li></ul>Credential Management:ProxyRenewal v. 1.0.24-1 released in SL5 and SL6:<ul><li>This is a bugfix release fixing memory handling issues and also minor packaging issues.</li></ul>Authentication:Unicore-Uvos v. 1.6.0 released in SL5, SL6 and debian:<ul><li>This is the first release in the UMD-3. UVOS is a component that acts as an &nbsp;information point and organises entities within a hierarchical group structure.</li></ul>

item.description: UMD 3.2.0 is the second update of the third Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release contains support for both Scientific Linux 5 and 6 and also Debian 6 (Squeeze).
item.releaseNotes: This release contains the following products:<i>Accounting:</i>APEL 2.2.0 released in SL5 and SL6:<ul><li>This release provides a security update.</li></ul>QCG-Accounting 3.1.0 released in SL5<ul><li>This is the first release in UMD.</li></ul>&nbsp;<i>Job Execution:</i>CREAM 1.16.1 released in SL5 and SL6:<ul><li>This release implements EMI CANL for authentication and authorization</li><li>This release provides some bugfixes name to the need of services restart after configuring with yaim.</li></ul>CREAM-GE 2.1.0 released in SL5 and SL6: :<ul><li>&nbsp;This is a bugfix release which solves some issues in both glite-info-dynamic-ge and the glite-yaim-ge-utils.</li></ul>Glexec 1.2.1 released in SL5, SL6 and Debian:<ul><li>This release provides some bugfixes to lcmaps, lcmaps-plugins-basic and lcmaps-plugins-voms. Also this version provides a new LCAS-LCMAPS-GT4-Interface version which provides an extra functionality for gsissh and gridftp, allowing LCMAPS to act on the specified desired username. </li></ul>UNICORE-X6 6.0.1 released in SL5, Sl6 and Debian:<ul><li>This release provides a new version of the EMI-ES and bug fixe for the unicore-config-update.py tool (debian). </li></ul>QCG Comp 3.0.4 released in SL5:<ul><li>This is the first release in UMD</li></ul><i>Authorization</i>:ARGUS 1.6.1 released in SL5 and SL6:<ul><li>This release provides some bug fixes namely the fact that pap-admin ban doesn't convert DN in OpenSSL format to rfc2253.</li></ul><i>Client tool:</i>EMI-UI 3.0.2 released in SL5 and SL6:<ul><li>Added dependency on globus-gsi-cert-utils-progs, providing "grid-cert-info".</li></ul>QCG-broker-client 3.0.1 released in SL5:<ul><li>&nbsp;This is the first release in UMD.&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;</li></ul><i>Information model service:</i>EMIR 2.0.0 released in SL5 and SL6:<ul><li>This is the first release in UMD-3. This release includes both new version of emir-server and emir-serp. From this release there is support for auto-pagination and registration of service endpoints in GLUE 2.0 XML format.</li></ul>BDII-Top 1.1.1, BDII-Site 1.2.1 and BDII-Core 1.5.2 released in SL5 and SL6:<ul><li>This release provides bug fixes and a security update</li></ul><i>Job Scheduling:</i>GRIDWAY 5.14.0 release only in SL5:<ul><li>&nbsp;This release provies a new driver for the EMI-ES based on an ARC Client plug-in. Several bug fixes are also provided in this release.</li></ul>WMS 3.6.0 release in SL5 and SL6:<ul><li>Bug fix release. After update re-run YAIM.QCG Broker 3.0.1 release in SL5:</li></ul><ul><li>This is the first release in UMD&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;</li></ul><i>File Transfer:</i>GRIDFTP 5.2.4 released in SL5, SL6 and Debian:<ul><li>This released of gridftp among several bug fixes now provides support for default disk and network stacks, setting file modification time and ability (MLSC) to stream directory listings over the control channel.</li></ul><i>Storage Management:</i>DCACHE 2.6.5 released in both Sl5 and Sl6:<ul><li>This is first release in UMD-3. Among other new features, this release provides support for certificates with SHA-2 and a new JSON API prototype together with a new command to find out files locality.</li></ul><i>Attribute authority:</i>VOMS Admin 3.2.0 released in SL5 and SL6:<ul><li>This release provides several bug fixes and improvements, in particular for the groups management.</li></ul><p><i>Other</i>:YAIM-CORE release in SL5 and SL6:</p><ul><li>This release provides a new functionality that config_mkgridmap prevents standard grid-mapfile on both FTS and LFC.</li></ul>CANL 2.1.2 released in SL5 and SL6<ul><li>Bug fix release. Fixed a bug affecting RFC proxies.</li></ul>Gridsite 2.1.2 released in SL5 and SL6<ul><li>Bug fix release, now dash character is allowed in delegation IDs.</li></ul>QCG NTF 3.0.3 released in SL5<ul><li>This is the first release in UMD</li></ul>BLAH 1.20.2<ul><li>This is a bug fix release</li></ul>LB 4.0.11 released in SL5 and SL6:<ul><li>This is a bug fix release. After update re-configure with YAIM</li></ul><i></i>
item.installationNotes:

item.description: UMD 3.14.4 is a revision update of the third Major release of UMD. In particular, it contains new packages and updates both for SL6 and SL5.
item.releaseNotes: This release contains the following products: *** SL6 and SL5* Credential managementGrisite 2.3.2canL 2.1.7*** PLEASE READ CAREFULLY ***A known issue has been reported by WLCG with canL upgrade on SL6 shipped with this release. canL 2.1.7 triggers an openssl upgrade to openssl-1.0.1e, which can conflict with the dracut-fips package. The dracut-fips package is not part of UMD, but it can come installed with the base system, although it is not often the case. The UMD team recommends to remove the dracut-fips package if not needed by the base system, right before upgrading to canL 2.1.7. In case you need dracut-fips instead, please contact the EGI Software Provisioning SU through GGUS to get support to resolve the conflict.

item.description: UMD 3.13.0 is the fourteenth update, a minor update, of the third Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release contains support for both Scientific Linux 5 and 6.
item.releaseNotes: This release contains the following products. <h2>Compute Capabilities, Job Execution Capability, Parallel Job Capability</h2><h3>CREAM 1.16.5 (SL6 only)</h3>This version of CREAM fixes several bugs, see <a href="http://www.eu-emi.eu/releases/emi-3-monte-bianco/updates/-/asset_publisher/5Na8/content/update-24-16-02-2015-v-3-15-0-1#CREAM_v_1_16_5">http://www.eu-emi.eu/releases/emi-3-monte-bianco/updates/-/asset_publisher/5Na8/content/update-24-16-02-2015-v-3-15-0-1#CREAM_v_1_16_5</a> for more details.<h2>Accounting Capability, Operations Capabilities</h2><h3>APEL 1.4.1</h3>Added ability to process files compressed with bzip2. Added multiplier retrieval to GridEngine parser for CPU and wall-clock time. Fixed integer overflow when loading normalised summaries into APEL servers. Corrected the way some logging calls were made and reduced the logging level when trying to purge a directory that isn't empty. Changed server authorization system to keep the list of DNs for a limited time if unable to update from GOCDB and updated GOCDB query URL. Added Month and Year columns to primary key of CloudSummaries table in cloud schema. See <a href="https://github.com/apel/apel/blob/1.4.0-1/CHANGELOG">https://github.com/apel/apel/blob/1.4.0-1/CHANGELOG</a> for more.<h2>Client Capabilities, Client Tools Capability</h2><h3>srm-ifce 1.22.1</h3>This update for SRM-IFCE contains one improvement and some bug fixes. Please have a look at <a href="http://dmc.web.cern.ch/release/srm-ifce-1.22.1">http://dmc.web.cern.ch/release/srm-ifce-1.22.1</a> for further details.<h2>Authentication Capability, Authorization Capability, Security Capabilities</h2><h3>gLExec 1.2.3</h3>This release of gLEXEC contains lcmaps-plugins-c-pep 1.3.0-1, with the following improvements: implement support for multiple endpoints (either round-robin, round-robin with random startpoint or fully random)number of improvements in the loggingcheck for unhandled obligations in the response. *A full list of changes can be found in the NEWS file in the packagePlease refer to <a href="http://www.eu-emi.eu/releases/emi-3-monte-bianco/updates/-/asset_publisher/5Na8/content/update-25-09-03-2015-v-3-15-1-1#gLExec_wn_v_1_2_3">http://www.eu-emi.eu/releases/emi-3-monte-bianco/updates/-/asset_publisher/5Na8/content/update-25-09-03-2015-v-3-15-1-1#gLExec_wn_v_1_2_3</a> for a complete reference.<h2>File Access Capability, File Transfer Capability, Storage Capabilities, Storage Management Capability</h2><h3>StoRM server 1.11.8</h3>This release fixes a critical issue that prevented the proper cleanup of PtP requests state after an srmRm was called on a SURL. As a consequence, a SURL could remain stuck and it would be impossible to perform other PtPs on that SURL without cleaning the database state by hand. All sites should upgrade to 1.11.8 at their earliest convenience to avoid being affected by this issue.This release also provides other fixes and improvements as can be seen from the individual components release notes. Please refer to <a href="http://italiangrid.github.io/storm/release-notes/StoRM-v1.11.8.html">http://italiangrid.github.io/storm/release-notes/StoRM-v1.11.8.html</a> for further details.<h3>dpm-xroot 3.5.2</h3>Please refer to <a href="https://svnweb.cern.ch/trac/lcgdm/wiki/Dpm/Xroot/vomsxrd">https://svnweb.cern.ch/trac/lcgdm/wiki/Dpm/Xroot/vomsxrd</a> for further details.<h3>XRootD 4.1.1</h3>The complete list of the improvements and bug fixes can be read at the following link: <a href="http://xrootd.org/download/ReleaseNotes.html">http://xrootd.org/download/ReleaseNotes.html</a><h3>CVMFS 2.1.20 </h3>Version 2.1.20 contains a number of new features and several bugfixes. Please refer to <a href="http://cernvm.cern.ch/portal/filesystem/cvmfs-2.1.20">http://cernvm.cern.ch/portal/filesystem/cvmfs-2.1.20</a> for further details.<h3>Frontier Squid 2.7.24 </h3>Please refer to <a href="http://frontier.cern.ch/dist/rpms-debug/frontier-squidRELEASE_NOTES">http://frontier.cern.ch/dist/rpms-debug/frontier-squidRELEASE_NOTES</a> for details on the new version of Frontier Squid.<h2>cas, Miscellaneous</h2><h3>fetch-crl 3.0.16 </h3>Several important fixes are available with this fetch-crl update, information available at <a href="https://dist.eugridpma.info/distribution/util/fetch-crl/CHANGES">https://dist.eugridpma.info/distribution/util/fetch-crl/CHANGES</a><h3>GFAL 2.8.4</h3>This release fixes several bugs, please see <a href="http://dmc.web.cern.ch/release/gfal2-2.8.4">http://dmc.web.cern.ch/release/gfal2-2.8.4</a> for details.<h3>GFAL2-PYTHON 1.7.1</h3>Please have a look at <a href="http://dmc.web.cern.ch/release/gfal2-python-1.7.1">http://dmc.web.cern.ch/release/gfal2-python-1.7.1</a> for details on the new version of this package.

item.description: UMD 3.11.0 is the eleventh update of the third Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release contains  support for both Scientific Linux 5 and 6 and also Debian 6 (Squeeze).
item.releaseNotes:
This release contains the following products:Accounting<ul><li><b>APEL, v. 1.3.1,</b> versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This update fixes some issues and provides new features like:</li><ul><li>Corrected the handling of multiple FQANs in blah logs so that the role 
and group are taken from the first (i.e. primary) FQAN rather than the 
last. This will impact the summarising of job records when there are 
multiple roles and groups listed.</li><li>Added support for parsing fractional seconds in XML usage records.</li></ul><li> For more details see <a href="https://github.com/apel/apel/blob/1.3.1-1/CHANGELOG">Extended Changelog</a></li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>APEL SSM, v. 2.1.5,</b> versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This update fixes some issues like:</li><ul><li> The highest version of SSL/TLS available is now used (previously only SSL 3.0).</li><li> Minor tweaks made to logging calls and the logging level of certain messages.</li></ul><li> For more details see <a href="https://github.com/apel/ssm/blob/2.1.5-1/CHANGELOG">Extended Changelog</a></li></ul></ul><p>Attribute authority</p><ul><li><b>VOMS server, v. 2.0.12 & VOMS-admin server, v. 3.3.1</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>More details in the <a href="http://italiangrid.github.io/voms/release-notes/voms-admin-server/3.3.1">VOMS-admin server 3.3.1 - Extended release notes</a></li><li>More details in the <a href="http://italiangrid.github.io/voms/release-notes/voms-server/2.0.12-2" target="_blank"> </a><a href="http://italiangrid.github.io/voms/release-notes/voms-server/2.0.12-2">VOMS server 2.0.12-2 - Extended release notes</a></li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>UNICORE XUUDB v. 2.1.2</b>, versions for SL6 and Deb 6:</li><ul><li>More details in the <a href="http://unicore.eu/documentation/manuals/unicore6/files/xuudb/manual.html">Extended Release Notes & Documentation</a></li></ul></ul><p>Authentication</p><ul><li><b>Globus GSI  C & GSI-OpenSSH v. 6.0.0</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>More details in the <a href="http://toolkit.globus.org/toolkit/docs/6.0/rn/#rn">GT 6.0 Extended Release Notes</a> and <a href="http://toolkit.globus.org/toolkit/docs/6.0/gsic/rn/#gsicRN">GSI C </a>and <a href="http://toolkit.globus.org/toolkit/docs/6.0/gsiopenssh/rn/#gsiopensshRN">GSI-OpenSSH</a></li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>UNICORE-Gateway v. 7.2.0</b>, versions for SL6 and Deb 6:</li><ul><li>fix: message charset was always ISO-8859-1, and UFT-8 characters were not properly transmitted (SF bug # 770)</li><li>initial support for multipart POST messages (but SOAP part must be first) (SF feature #292)</li><li>More details in the <a href="http://unicore.eu/documentation/manuals/unicore6/files/gateway/manual.html">Extended Release Notes & Documentation</a></li></ul></ul><p>Client Tools</p><ul><li><b>GFAL2-util, v. 1.1.0</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This update fixes some issues and provides new features like:</li><ul><li>fix for is_alive is not available in Python 2.4 (EL5)</li><li>support input from file in gfal-copy and gfal-del</li><li>Create a cli around xattr+replicas to ease its use</li></ul><li>For more details see <a href="http://dmc.web.cern.ch/release/gfal2-util-1.1.0">Extended Release Notes</a></li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>VOMS clients v. 3.0.6 & native 2.0.12-2 , VOMS Java APIs, v. 3.0.5</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This update fixes some issues and provides new features - more details at:</li><ul><li><a href="http://www.eu-emi.eu/releases/emi-3-monte-bianco/updates/-/asset_publisher/5Na8/content/update-22-10-11-2014-v-3-13-0-1#VOMS_clients_v_3_0_5_native_2_0">Extended Release Notes</a></li><li><a href="http://www.eu-emi.eu/releases/emi-3-monte-bianco/updates/-/asset_publisher/5Na8/content/update-23-16-12-2014-v-3-14-0-1#VOMS_clients_v_3_0_6_and_VOMS_Ja">Extended Release Notes (3.0.6)</a></li></ul></ul></ul><p>Credential management</p><ul><li><b>MyProxy, v. 6.1.10</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>More details in the <a href="http://toolkit.globus.org/toolkit/docs/6.0/rn/#rn-bycomponents">GT 6.0 Extended Release Notes</a> and <a href="http://toolkit.globus.org/toolkit/docs/6.0/myproxy/rn/#myproxyRN">MyProxy Release Notes</a></li></ul></ul><ul><li id="aui_3_2_0_1215"><b>gLite-ProxyRenewal v. 1.3.36</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li id="aui_3_2_0_1215">This is a rebuild of ProxyRenewal with the new major version of MyProxy 
(v. 6). There were updated manual pages. This revision also introduces 
packaging updates to better follow existing packaging guidelines, and 
missing runtime dependency on psmisc were added. </li><li id="aui_3_2_0_1215">For more details see <a href="https://github.com/CESNET/proxyrenewal/wiki/Px-release-page#PX_10261">PX 1.0.26-1 - Extended Release Notes</a></li></ul></ul>Data Acces<ul><li><b>DAVIX, v. </b><b>0.4.0</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This update fixes some issues and provides new features like:</li><ul><li>Davix follows redirection automatically even though redirectionSupport is switched off</li><li>Davix: POODLE vulnerability CVE-2014-3566 affects libneon, then davix</li><li>DAVIX : implement a list bucket feature for davix on the opendir/readdir model</li></ul><li>For more details see <a href="http://dmc.web.cern.ch/release/davix-040">Extended Release Notes</a></li></ul></ul><p>File Access, File Transfer, Storage Management</p><ul><li><b>DPM/LFC, v. </b><b>1.8.9</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This update fixes some issues and provides new features like:</li><ul><li id="aui_3_2_0_1306"> Extensive Logging Consolidation effort in the core components, the source structure, and the test infrastructure</li><li> Several high impact performance improvements in the core components In-memory caching of pool/fs info in DMLite adapter</li><li> Bye bye YAIM, welcome Puppet</li></ul><li>For more details see <a href="https://svnweb.cern.ch/trac/lcgdm/blog/dpm_1.8.9_relnotes">Extended Release Notes</a></li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>FTS3, v. 3.2.30</b>, version for SL6:</li><ul><li>This is the first release in UMD of FTS3 - "the production FTS service for all the LHC experiments"</li><li>For more details see <a href="http://fts3-service.web.cern.ch/documentation/releases#FTS%203.2.30">Extended Release Notes</a></li></ul></ul><p>
</p><ul><li><b>Frontier SQUID, v. 2.7STABLE9-21.1</b>, version for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This is the first release in UMD of Frontier SQUID </li><li>For more details see <a href="http://frontier.cern.ch/dist/rpms/frontier-squidRELEASE_NOTES">Extended Release Notes</a></li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>Globus GridFTP, v. 6.0</b>, version for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>For more details see the <a href="http://toolkit.globus.org/toolkit/docs/6.0/gridftp/rn/#gridftpRN">Extended Release Notes</a></li></ul></ul><p>Information Discovery</p><ul><li><b>Globus InfoProviderService, v. 0.2.1</b>, version for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>For more details see...</li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>UNICORE Registry v. 7.2.0</b>, versions for SL6 and Deb 6:</li><ul><li>More details in the <a href="http://unicore.eu/documentation/manuals/unicore6/files/registry/registry-manual.html">Extended Release Notes & Documentation</a></li></ul></ul><p>Job Execution, Job Scheduling</p><ul><li><b>CREAM, v. </b><b>1.16.4</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This
 release provides bug fixes:</li><ul><li>The CREAM service does not depends anymore on VOMS client 2.x</li><li>Use <a class="twikiLink" href="https://twiki.cern.ch/twiki/bin/view/EMI/VOMS">VOMS</a>/CanL APIs instead of <a class="twikiLink" href="https://twiki.cern.ch/twiki/bin/view/EMI/VOMS">VOMS</a> UI</li></ul><li>For more details see <a href="http://www.eu-emi.eu/releases/emi-3-monte-bianco/updates/-/asset_publisher/5Na8/content/update-21-09-10-2014-v-3-12-0-1#CREAM_v_1_16_4">Extended Release Notes</a></li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>Globus GRAM5, v. 6.0.1</b>, version for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>For more details see<a href="http://toolkit.globus.org/toolkit/docs/6.0/gram5/rn/#gram5RN"> Extended Release notes</a></li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>QCG-Computing, v. 3.4.0</b>, versions for SL6:</li><ul><li>This
 release provides </li><ul><li>Updated Java SDK to use JGlobus 2.0.8</li><li>Created RPM package for application scripts (qcg-appscripts)</li><li>Bug fixes</li></ul><li>For more details see <a href="http://www.qoscosgrid.org/trac/qcg-computing/export/HEAD/tags/current/RELEASE_NOTES#1">Extended Release Notes</a></li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>UNICORE TSI v. 7.2.0</b>, versions for SL6 and Deb 6:</li><ul><li>fixes</li><ul><li>newline characters in filenames break listDirectory (SF #769)</li><li>Slurm: remove extra "\n" when setting account</li><li>cleanup SSL code, make it more portable with respect to IPv6/IPv4. Use separate key and certificate files.</li><li>in non-SSL mode, configuring the tsi.njsport is mandatory</li></ul><li>updated docs on configuring SSL</li><li>added section on securing/hardening the TSI to the manual </li><li>More details in the <a href="http://unicore.eu/documentation/manuals/unicore6/files/tsi/tsi-manual.html">Extended Release Notes & Documentation</a></li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>UNICORE/X v. 7.2.0</b>, versions for SL6 and Deb 6:</li><ul><li>new features: </li><ul><li>support Unity with OIDC (SF feature #344)</li><li>support S3 as backend storage (SF feature #342)</li></ul><li>fixes: </li><ul><li>data triggering could miss some files</li><li>file existence check (to compensate for slow filesystems) did not work (SF bug #762)</li><li>REST authentication: only first authentication option was used, SAML AuthN was buggy</li></ul><li>More details in the <a href="http://unicore.eu/documentation/manuals/unicore6/files/unicorex/unicorex-manual.html">Extended Release Notes & Documentation</a></li></ul></ul><p>Job Scheduling</p><ul><li><b>WMS v. 3.6.6-2</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li id="aui_3_2_0_1215"> This is a rebuild of WMS-ICE with the new major version of MyProxy (v. 6)</li></ul></ul>Messaging<ul><li><b>QCG-Notification, v. 3.4.0</b>, versions for SL6:</li><ul><li>This
 release provides</li><ul><li>Disabled KEEP_ALIVE flag for the anonymous and SSL publishers.</li><li>Updated requirement for qcg-core to the version 3.4.0.</li><li>Minor fixes</li></ul><li>For more details see <a href="http://www.qoscosgrid.org/trac/qcg-notification/export/HEAD/tags/current/RELEASE_NOTES#1">Extended Release Notes</a></li></ul></ul>Other<ul><li><b>BLAH v. 1.20.7</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This release fixes the following bugs:
		</li><ul><li> <a href="https://issues.infn.it/jira/browse/CREAM-155">CREAM-155</a> - BUpdate interval does not work with GE</li><li> <a href="https://issues.infn.it/jira/browse/CREAM-152">CREAM-152</a> - Wrong condor_status renaming in postinst</li></ul></ul></ul><ul><li><b>CGSI-gSOAP, v. 1.3.7</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This update fixes:</li><ul><li>x509_* data members are leaking</li><li>CGSI-soap changes to be more verbose and meaningful</li></ul><li>For more details see <a href="http://dmc.web.cern.ch/release/cgsi-gsoap-1.3.7">Extended Release Notes</a></li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>CREAM TORQUE module, v. 2.1.4</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This
 release provides bug fixes:</li><ul><li>Missing check in triggerun for lcg-info-dynamic-scheduler-pbs</li><li>TORQUE provider should publish undefined values</li></ul><li>For more details see <a href="http://www.eu-emi.eu/releases/emi-3-monte-bianco/updates/-/asset_publisher/5Na8/content/update-18-07-07-2014-v-3-9-0-1#CREAM_TORQUE_v_2_1_4">Extended Release Notes</a></li></ul></ul><h3> <a name="Installation_Configuration_AN2"></a></h3><ul><li><b>CREAM GE module</b>,  <b>v. 2.3.2 </b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This release provides multiple bugfix afecting the info-dynamic-scheduler and also an improved Glue2 support</li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>DMLITE, v. 0.7.2</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This update provides:</li><ul><li>BugFix for too much verbose logging</li></ul><li>For more details see the <a href="https://svnweb.cern.ch/trac/lcgdm/attachment/wiki/Dpm/dmlite0.7.2-relnotes.txt">Extended Release Notes</a> and <a href="https://svnweb.cern.ch/trac/lcgdm/blog/dmlite0.7.2_epelstable_setlogto1">More Details</a></li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>GFAL2, v. 2.7.8</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This update fixes a file (gfal2_load_opts_from_file)</li></ul><li>For more details see <a href="http://dmc.web.cern.ch/release/gfal2-python-1.6.0">Extended Release Notes</a></li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>SRM-ifce, v. item.releaseNotes: This release contains the following products:<b>EMI Technology Provider:</b>Client tools:EMI UI v. 3.0.1-1 both in SL5 and SL6:<ul><li>This release its a repacking version and just solves the missing dependencies on gsi-openssh-clients and glite-ce-monitor-cli.</li></ul>GFAL/lcg_util 1.15.0 &nbsp;both in SL5 and SL6:<ul><li>This release contains no new functionalities and provides solutions to several bugfixes for the mkgltempdir, lcmaps lcmaps-plugins-basic and lcmaps-plugins-voms packages.</li></ul>CANl 2.1.1 both in SL5 and SL6:<ul><li>This release introduces new features in caNl-Java, specifically PKCS12 keystores supporting unlimited JCA policy and a new method to save a X509Credential as a PEM keystore. caNl-c API has ben extended with an function to set OCSP URL.</li><li>This release also adress several bugfixes namelly the one on which the ProxyCSRGenerator assigns a wrong serial for RFC proxies.</li></ul><br/>

item.description: UMD 3.1.0 is the 1st update of the third Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release contains support for both Scientific Linux 5 and 6 and also Debian 6 (Squeeze).
item.releaseNotes: This release contains the following products:<b>EMI Technology Provider:</b><b>Job Execution services:</b>CREAM LSF 2.0.2, task<ul><li>This releases provides a new koji Make-file together with &nbsp;a new make test for the perl module.</li></ul>WMS &nbsp;3.5.1<ul><li>This release solves a vulnerability bug.</li></ul>GLite CLUSTER 2.0.0-2 released in both SL5 and SL6:<ul><li>This release is just a repackaging of EMI-2 glite-CLUSTER components.</li></ul>ARC CE 3.0.1 released in SL5, SL6 and Debian:<ul><li>This release provides several bug fixes namely the one related with the LSF backend as well as cluster.pl and qju.pl do no cope well with "-" values.</li></ul>UNICORE TSI6 5.1.0 released in SL5, SL6 and Debian:<ul><li>No new functionality or bug fixes, simple repacking.</li></ul>UNICORE X/6 6.0.0 released in SL5, SL6 and Debian:<ul><li>The UNICORE Registry was updated to use the Common Authentication Library (CANL). Also the configuration file syntax has been unified and made more consistent.&nbsp;</li></ul><b>Client tools:</b>ARC Clients &nbsp;3.0.1 released in SL5, SL6 and Debian:<ul><li>This release provides some improvements in error and help messages, together with some bug fixes. Now it is possible to start jobs when using 3.0.0rc1 arc client tools and also &nbsp;the incompatibility &nbsp;between jobs.xml arc2.0 and 3.0 as been solved.</li></ul>UNICORE Client6 6.0.0 released in SL5, SL6 and Debian:<ul><li>This release provides an updated which enables the use of the Common Authentication Library (CANL).&nbsp;</li></ul><b>Parallel Job:</b>gLite-MPI v. 1.5.0 released in SL5, SL6 and Debian::<ul><li>This release now provides the functionality of making a generic copy from remote node available for ssh and cpshared methods.&nbsp;</li></ul><b>Information Discovery, Information Model</b>BDII core &nbsp;1.5.1 released in both SL5 and SL6:<ul><li>Bug fix release affecting all BDII flavours on which Obsolete GLUE 2 entries were never removed from the BDII. Also solves the missing symlink to the customised LDAP DB configuration file.</li><li>This release also contains a new version of the glue-validator and of the glue-validator-cron.</li></ul>ARC Infosys &nbsp;3.0.1 released in SL5, SL6 and Debian:<ul><li>No new features have been added in this version.</li><li>This release provides several bug fixes one of then was the nordugrid-arc-slapd was not able to start in debian.</li></ul><b>File Access,File Transfer,Storage Management</b><br/>STORM, 1.11.1 released in both SL5 and SL6:<ul><li>This release provides the bug fixes and improvements for the StoRM services namely now StoRM correctly publishes information about storage area sizes in the information system as well as SHA-2 compliance.</li></ul>ARC gridftp server &nbsp;3.0.1 released in SL5, SL6 and Debian:<ul><li>No new features or bugs fixes Simple repacking.</li></ul>DPM 1.8.6-3 released in both SL5 and SL6:<ul><li>This release only provides an update of the dpm-xrootd.</li></ul><b>Authentication:</b>UNICORE Gateway6 5.0.0 released in SL5, SL6 and Debian:<ul><li>This release provides several new functionalities including the support of new credential formats: PEM, PEM pair, DER.</li></ul><b>Information Discovery:</b>UNICORE Registry6 6.0.0 released in SL5, SL6 and Debian:<ul><li>The UNICORE Registry was updated to use the Common Authentication Library (CANL).</li></ul><b>Attribute Authority:</b>UNICORE XUUDB 2.0.0 released in SL5, SL6 and Debian:<ul><li>This release provides support &nbsp;for dynamic mapping of Grid users to local accounts, using pools of pregenerated uids/gids or scripts creating accounts on the fly. Product uses common UNICORE libraries for authentication and HTTP server setup. Therefore it supports the same options as all other UNICORE 6.6 for configuring truststores, credentials and HTTP server. Among others directory truststore, openssl-like truststore and PEM credentials are supported.</li></ul><b>Credential Management:</b>glite-proxyrenewal 1.3.32 released in both SL5 and SL6:<ul><li>No new functionalities and now the self authorization option for MyProxy is now supported by the YAIM configurator.</li><li>The dependency on yaim was solved on Debian.</li></ul><b>Monitoring:</b>L &amp; B 4.0.9 released in both SL5 and SL6:<ul><li>This release provides a bugfix regarding the addresses of several distinct issues relating to nagios probe customization, proper handling of rarely used authorization roles, and purging of jobs from the L&amp;B Proxy.</li></ul>

item.description: UMD 3.0 is the third Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release contains support for both Scientific Linux 5 and 6 and also Debian 6 (Squeeze).
item.releaseNotes: This release contains the following products:<b>EMI Technology Provider:</b>Job Execution services:WMS 3.4.0 released in SL5 and SL6:<ul><li>Major release which introduces GLUE 2.0 support, integration with Condor 7.8.0, new DAG engine replacing the previous DAGMAN functionality and also support for RFC proxies.</li><li>This release dismisses support for WMProxy Java and Python API</li></ul>CREAM 1.15.1<ul><li>EMIR integration.</li><li>CREAM TORQUE module 2.1.0</li><li>TORQUE server config 1.0.1-2&nbsp;</li><li><b>Note: This version of CREAM automatically installs the APEL 2.1.0 clients. Please, read the CREAM and APEL additional details on <a href="http://wiki.egi.eu/wiki/UMD-3:UMD-3.0.0">wiki</a> for further information about the deployment in production of the new APEL clients, or about how to use the old clients.</b></li></ul>Information Model,Information Discovery:BDII top v. 1.1.0 released both in SL5 and SL6<ul><li>GLUE 2.0 LDAP URLs can now be used by both the site and the top BDII. This means that site resources and resources in GOCDB can be defined using their GLUE 2 LDAP URL.</li><li>Several fixes at packaging level to be EPEL compliant.</li></ul>BDII core v. 1.5.0 released both in SL5 and SL6<ul><li>Now ARC resources can now be published in the top level BDII.</li><li>EMIR integration: new YAIM function config_emir_serp is now available to automatically publish service information into EMIR.</li><li>Service information provider bug fixes and enhancements together with fixes at packaging level to be EPEL compliant.</li></ul>BDII site v. 1.2.0 released both in SL5 and SL6<ul><li>Service information provider bug fixes and enhancements together with fixes at packaging level to be EPEL compliant.</li></ul>Authentication:CANL v. 2.0.7<ul><li>This release includes multiple bugfixes and implements support for additional security standards including OCSP and SHA2.</li></ul>gLite-gsoap/gss v. 3.2.0<ul><li>This is an EMI-3 release of GSS/gsoap-plugin. There were only packaging updates. The functionality remains unaffected.</li></ul>Accounting:APEL publisher v. 4.1.0<ul><li>Major version and this version of APEL Publisher is compatible only with APEL Parsers 2.1.0 and above. Also support SLURM batch system.</li><li>New &nbsp;capabilities available for accounting.&nbsp;</li><li><b>Note: the deployment of the APEL clients requires particular attention, please read the additional details on <a href="http://wiki.egi.eu/wiki/UMD-3:UMD-3.0.0">wiki</a>.</b></li></ul>Authorization:ARGUS v. 1.6.0 released in SL5, SL6 and Debian 6<ul><li>Uses the new common authentication library (CANL) and new VOMS library (voms-api-java3).</li><li>Debian 6 platform support added.</li></ul>glExec-WN 1.2.0 released in SL5 and SL6<ul><li>Minor version with no new functionalities neverthelss it contaims many big fixes for Glexec, lcas, lcmaps and for the several lcmaps-plugins availabel.</li><li>Job Execution:</li></ul>EMI-WN v. 3.0.0 released both in SL5 and SL6<ul><li>Several bug fixes in many of the clients: Gridsite, lcg-info-system, yaim, voms.&nbsp;</li><li>This version present a complete redesign of the VOMS clients based on the new VOMS Java&nbsp;</li></ul>TORQUE WN 1.0.0-3&nbsp;<ul><li>This version is a single repacking from the EMI-2 version.</li></ul>Information Model:L&amp;B v. 4.0.4 released both in SL5 and SL6<ul><li>This release of L&amp;B introduces several new features, including the support for virtual machine state monitoring, registration of inter-entity relationships, URL-based job queries, customizable RSS feeds, branded look of L&amp;B's HTML output, and other improvements. There are also multiple bug fixes.</li><li>Backward Incompatible: DB schema change. Configuration scripts update the DB automatically, manual update script provided.</li></ul>File Access,File Transfer,Storage Management:DPM 1.8.6 released in SL5 and SL6<ul><li>This version is a single repacking from the EMI-2 version. No new functionality has been introduced.</li></ul>Metadata Catalogue:LFC 1.8.6 released in SL5 and SL6<ul><li>This version is a single repacking from the EMI-2 version. No new functionality has been introduced.</li></ul>Client Tools:GFAL/lcg_util 1.14.0 released in SL5 and SL6<ul><li>The new version of GFAL/lcg_Utils provides the possibility to enable IPV6 in gfal 2.0 grisftp plugin by the config file&nbsp;implementation</li><li>Important fixe related with the storm spacetoken which triggered timeouts.</li></ul>EMI-UI 3.0.0 released in SL5 and SL6:<ul><li>In this release there are improved functionalities in the several of the clients namely in the ARC, Unicore, VOMS and WMS. Several Bug fixes are also present.</li></ul>None:APEL parsers v. 2.1.0<ul><li>Major version and parser is only only compatible with APEL Publisher 4.1.0 and above.</li><li>Support added for SLURM batch system.</li></ul>&nbsp;gridsite v. 2.0.4 released in SL5 and SL6<ul><li>gridsite_mod internals have been significantly refactored and new authentication features have been introduced by a dependence on EMI's common authentication library (caNl).</li><li>unused components removed: gsexec, slashgrid, gridsite-copy.cgi and gridsite-storage.cgi.</li></ul>lcg-info-clients 1.0.1<ul><li>This is a repackaged version of the EMI 2 release</li></ul>glite-yaim-core 5.1.1<ul><li>This release contain 2 bug fixes regarding the incorrect cleanup-grid-accounts path present in the config_users and the issue of the config_secure_tomcat keeps adding comments to tomcat6.conf.</li></ul><b>IGE Technology Provider:</b>Globus-32-bit 5.2.4<ul><li>Globus 32 bit libraries needed to satisfy emi-wn dependencies</li></ul>

item.description: UMD 2.7.0 is the 9th update of second Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release supports both Scientific Linux 5 and 6.
item.releaseNotes: This release contains the following products:<b>EMI Technology Provider:</b>Job Execution services:CREAM-GE 2.0.2 release in SL5 and SL6:<ul><li>This is a bugfix release which solves some issues in both glite-info-dynamic-ge and the glite-yaim-ge-utils.</li></ul>Information Discovery:BDII-TOP released in SL5 and SL6:<ul><li>This version provide a bug fixes for the information provider on which the ldap queries were failing to get GLUE 2 Contact and Location information from site BDIIs together with a fix for the slow performance. The release also contains a minor fix in the glite-info-plugin-delayed-delete-status plugin.</li></ul>BDII-CORE released in SL5 and SL6<ul><li>This version provide a bug fixes &nbsp;for a hardcoded path affecting ARC installations. Also presente is a new version of glue-validator containing a series of improvements and a new command line.</li></ul>Storage Management:<br/>DPM 1.8.6-3 released in SL5 and SL6:<ul><li>This is a small release with an update of dpm-xrootd which &nbsp;now requires XRootD 3.3.x. This update is only needed if you have previously installed dpm-xrootd and so dpm-xrootd is not installed as a part of DPM by default.</li></ul>IGE Technology Provider:<br/>Globus-gsissh 5.3.9 released only in SL6:<ul><li>This is a very minimal release, covering one security vulnerabilities recently reported. No new functionality has been introduced.</li></ul><br/>
item.installationNotes: All products in the UMD 2.7.0 release were verified against EGI's current Quality Criteria (for further information, please see the documentation links) to support 64 bit Scientific Linux 5 and Scientific Linux 6 (x86_64 processor architecture). Some products are also supported in 64 bit Debian 6 (squeeze). &nbsp;Installation and configuration notes are available in the EGI repository.

item.description: UMD 2.6.0 is the 8th update of second Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release supports both Scientific Linux 5 and 6 as also Debian 6 (Squeeze).
item.releaseNotes: This release contains the following products:<b>EMI Technology Provider:</b>Job Execution services:UNICORE/X6 5.1.0 &nbsp;release in SL5, SL6 and Debian:<ul><li>This release provides several bug-fixes together with some new functionality like the metadata crawler (i.e. include exclude files) and also a improved information in case of errors from a job.</li></ul>UNICORE TSI6 5.1.0 release in SL5, SL6 and Debian:<ul><li>This is an update release of the TSI providing fixes for the resource reservation support in Maui/Torque and adding an implementation of resource reservation for Slurm.</li></ul>EMI-WN 2.0.1 released in SL5 and SL6:<ul><li>Simple repacking no new functionality</li></ul>Client Tools:GFAL/lcg_util 1.15.0 released in SL5 and SL6<ul><li>This releases present several bug-fixes namely for the lcg-gt and lcg-cp commands.</li></ul>gLExec-WN 1.1.2 released in SL5 and SL6:<ul><li>fix bug in -t option preventing it from working.</li></ul>EMI-UI 2.0.2-1 released in SL5 and SL6:<ul><li>This release adds dependencies on both gsi-openssh-clients and glite-ce-monitor-cli and also solves and and important issue on cream-cli on which the Character "=" would causes a crash of a submit job.</li></ul>

Some products are also supported in 64 bit Debian 6 (squeeze). &nbsp;Installation and configuration notes are available in the EGI repository.<br/>

item.description: UMD 2.5.0 is the 7th update of second Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release supports both Scientific Linux 5 and 6 as also Debian 6 (Squeeze).
item.releaseNotes: This release contains the following products:<b>EMI Technology Provider:</b>Job Execution services:CREAM Torque 2.0.1 <ul><li>Released in SL5 and SL6:</li><li>This is an update of the CREAM TORQUE module providing several bug fixes.</li><li>No new functionalities</li></ul>WMS 3.4.1 <ul><li>Released in SL5 and SL6:</li><li>This relase solves the bug about the WMS UI could not handle jobids starting with a -;</li></ul>Blah 1.18.3<ul><li> Released in both Sl5 and Sl6</li><li>This release solves a vulnerability bug</li></ul>Job Scheduling services:TORQUE server config v. 1.0.1-1:<ul><li>Released in  both Sl5 and Sl6</li><li>This release solves the following bug: CREAM CE/YAIM: add knob to disable SSH key scanning</li></ul>Monitoring services:L&B version 3.2.10 released in both SL5 and SL6:<ul><li>This bugfix release of L&B addresses several distinct issues relating to nagios probe customization, proper handling of rarely used authorization roles, and purging of jobs from the L&B Proxy. </li></ul><b>IGE Technology Provider:</b>File Access, File Transfer:GridFTP 5.2.3<ul><li>Released in SL5, SL6 and debian:</li><li>This release now provides for default disk and network stacks: globus-gridftp-server options -dc-default and -fs-default. It also provides server support for setting file modification tim and the ability (MLSC) to stream directory listings over the control channel.</li></ul>Interactive Job managementGsisshterm 1.3.4 <ul><li>Released in SL5, SL6 and debian:</li><li>This release allow to turn on VOMS support and also add VOMS support when using MyProxy Tool.</li></ul>Job Execution Gram5<ul><li>Released in SL5, SL6 and debian:</li><li>This release only provides bug Fix.</li></ul>
