item.description: UMD 2.3.1 is a revision of UMD 2.3.0 (Unified Middleware Distribution) release made available for the EGI production infrastructure.
item.releaseNotes: This release contains the following products:<b>EMI Technology Provider:</b><b>Storage services:</b>DPM 1.8.5 released in both SL5 and SL6:<ul><li>Publishing of GLUE2 information</li><li>New information system endpoints for xroot and webdav</li><li>Updated set of nagios plugins</li><li>Now the check_gridftp_tranfer probe counts the number of gridftp transfer failures</li><li>Minor bug fixes in several probes</li></ul>DCACHE 2.2.5<ul><li>New dcap-2.47.7-1 lib which fixes the issue on which the use of limited proxies resulted in gsi dcap getting stuck on client side.&nbsp;</li></ul><b>Authentication:</b>GRIDSITE 1.7.24 released in both SL5 and SL6:<ul><li>Affects CREAM and WN</li><li>Bugfix release, addressing a memory leak in function CreateProxyRequest.</li></ul><b>Metadata Catalogue services:</b>LFC 1.8.5 released in both SL5 and SL6:<ul><li>Publishing of GLUE2 information</li><li>New information system endpoints for xroot and webdav</li><li>Updated set of nagios plugins</li><li>Now the check_gridftp_tranfer probe counts the number of gridftp transfer failures</li><li>Minor bug fixes in several probes</li></ul><b>IGE Technology Provider:</b><b>File Transfer and File Access:</b>GRIDFTP 5.2.2 release in SL5, SL6 and Debian:<ul><li>New support for default disk and network stacks: globus-gridftp-server options -dc-default and -fs-default.&nbsp;</li><li>Several bug fixes</li><li>Added server support for setting file modification time.</li><li>Added ability (MLSC) to stream directory listings over the control channel.</li></ul>
item.installationNotes:
All products in the UMD 2.3.1 release were verified against EGI's current Quality Criteria (for further information, please see the documentation links) to support 64 bit Scientific Linux 5 and Scientific Linux 6 (x86_64 processor architecture). Some products are also supported in 64 bit Debian 6 (squeeze).

Installation and configuration notes are available in the EGI repository.

item.description: UMD 2.2.1 is a revision of &nbsp;UMD 2.2.0 (Unified Middleware Distribution) &nbsp;release &nbsp;made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release supports Scientific Linux 5 and 6.
item.releaseNotes: This release contains the following products:<b>IGE Technology Provider:</b>Job execution services:Globus GRAM5 5.2.2 released for SL5 and SL6<ul><li>Fixed a number of bugs found by OSG during high scalability testing.</li><li>Added job expiration and automatic cleanup for jobs that finish, but client does not do a final commit for several hours. This is configurable via RSL. Improves use of Condor-G for OSG.</li><li>Added site .rvf file support. This allows a site administrator to modify default RSL values and add or remove RSL attributes locally, without modifying packaged files. This allows configuration to remain when package updates are released.</li></ul>
item.installationNotes: This is the third update of the UMD-2 that is made available for EGI's production infrastructure. &nbsp;All products in the UMD 2.2.1 release were verified against EGI's current Quality Criteria (for further information, please see the documentation links) to support 64 bit Scientific Linux 5 and Scientific Linux 6 (x86_64 processor architecture). Some products are also supported in 64 bit Debian 6 (squeeze).<br/>Installation and configuration notes are available in the EGI repository: http://repository.egi.eu/category/umd_releases/distribution/umd_2/.

item.releaseNotes:
This release contains the following products: 
EMI Technology Provider:
Job Execution services:
CREAM 1.13.4 release: This release includes two important updates in the cream sub-components BLAH and gLite-gsoap/gss.

<ul><li>BLAH 1.16.6 update, fixes the problem of the bupdater for LSF which can leave job in IDLE state due to a timestamp problem.</li><li>gLite-gsoap/gss 3.0.3 update, fix a bug of the plugin by fixing buffer under-run during setting proxy filename. Remember that GSS module should be updated when globus-gssapi-gsi >= 10.6 (globus >= 5.2.1) is used.</li></ul>

Storage Management:
StoRM 1.8.3 release : This release solve the issue of read permission acl to others on configuration file and on the yaim-storm on which storage area roots does not belong to storm user.

Globus platform (Provided by IGE):
File Transfer and File Access:
Globus GRIDFTP 5.2.1:
<ul><li>On this new release of gridftp among several bug fixes, provided support for default disk and network stacks: globus-gridftp-server options -dc-default and -fs-default. It is also added server support for setting file modification time and added ability (MLSC) to stream directory listings over the control channel.</li></ul>

item.description: UMD 1.6.0 is the eighth release of UMD-1 (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure since its first release on 11 July 2011, and further expands on the included service available for deployment.
item.releaseNotes:
This release includes many updates to several platforms available in the Unified Middleware Distribution as further described below:

The <u>Globus platform</u>, augmented by IGE with several extension into its IGE-2 release end of January is almost completely included in this UMD release. IGE-2 raises the base-line of GTK components from the 5.0.x series to 5.2.x including a last-minute patch for Globus GridFTP 5.2.0 for maintaining backwards compatibility with EMI's current DPM and StoRM storage services. GridWay, GridSAM and the long waited for SAGA adaptors will be included in the next UMD release

The server side of the <u>UNICORE6</u> platform, delivered by EMI, received a complete update including local user management and VO services, raising the baseline of core UNICORE6 services to version 4.2.0. The remainder of the UNICORE6 platform are planned to be updated once they are published by EMI, with the next UMD release.

The <u>gLite platform</u> (also delivered by EMI) received a maintenance update involving various components (as listed below), and including fixes for two security vulnerabilities found in BDII and VOMS. As usual, additional information is available in the <a href="https://wiki.egi.eu/wiki/UMD-1:UMD-1.6.0">UMD 1.6.0 wiki entry</a>.
item.installationNotes: UMD 1 is available for 64bit Scientific Linux (i.e. x86_64 processor architecture).&nbsp;Installation notes and known issues found during EGI Software Verification and StagedRollout are collected on a per product base in the respective EGI <a href="https://wiki.egi.eu/wiki/UMD-1:UMD-1.6.0">Wiki entry for UMD 1.6.0.</a><br/>In general, software available in the UMD is installed according to the product's specific installation instructions provided by the Technology Provider. However, prior to installing the software you need to configure the repository from where to download the software - see the <a href="http://repository.egi.eu/category/umd_releases/distribution/umd_1/">UMD 1 repository configuration instructions</a> for additional details.

item.installationNotes: All products in the UMD 1.10.0 release were verified against EGI's&nbsp;current Quality Criteria (for further information, please see the&nbsp;documentation links) to support 64 bit Scientific Linux 5 (x86_64&nbsp;processor architecture).&nbsp;Installation and configuration notes are available in the<a href="http://repository.egi.eu/category/umd_releases/distribution/umd_1/"> EGI&nbsp;repository</a>.

item.description: UMD 1.1.0 is the 2nd release of UMD-1 (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release contains only the most critical products from EGI's Technology Providers as agreed by the TCB (Technology Coordination Board) on behalf of the EGI community.
item.releaseNotes: This release contains updates for <b>Proxyrenewal</b>, <b>UNICORE</b> <b>UVOS</b>, <b>Logging and Bookkeeping</b>, <b>BDII-core</b> and introduces <b>ARC Infosys</b> and <b>STORM</b> into the UMD.
item.installationNotes: <p class="p1">This is the second release of the UMD-1 that is made available for EGI's production infrastructure. &nbsp;All products in the&nbsp;<b>UMD 1.1.0&nbsp;</b>release were verified against EGI's current Quality Criteria (for further information, please see the documentation links) to support 64bit Scientific Linux 5 (x86_64 processor architecture). &nbsp;Installation notes and known issues are collected on a per-product basis, and are available in the EGI Wiki. When browsing the EGI Repository, each product available in this release will provide a link to the respective entry in the mentioned Wiki space, providing specific information about any issues discovered during Verification and/or StagedRollout. &nbsp;For more information on EGI's Software Provisioning process, see&nbsp;<a href="https://documents.egi.eu/document/505">MS508</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a href="https://documents.egi.eu/document/478">MS409</a>.</p>
item.contact: For further information about the UMD, its goals and surrounding processes, and more information about how to engage as a Technology Provider with EGI, please send an Email to: cto (at) egi.eu.
item.technicalContact: For any bugs and issues you encounter that are not described in the release notes of this UMD release, or the related documentation provided by the Technology Providers, please visit the <a href="https://ggus.eu/pages/home.php">EGI Helpdesk</a> to make a report
item.knownIssues: <p class="p1">As this is the second release of UMD-1, and uses a different structure than previous releases of these products, each product must be installed from scratch as in-place updates are not supported for non UMD releases &nbsp;If you are upgrading from UMD 1.0.0 release then in-place upgrades are supported. Please consult the product specific installation instructions provided by EMI, the Technology Provider delivering the components in this release.</p><p class="p1">Additional installation notes are collected on a per-product base, and are available in the&nbsp;<a href="https://wiki.egi.eu/wiki/UMD-1:UMD-1.1.0">EGI Wiki</a>&nbsp;(see Additional Details for more information)</p>
item.changeLog:
In this release we have included the following. 
Product Updates: 
* Proxyrenewal 1.3.21, 
* UNICORE UVOS 1.4.2, 
* Logging and Bookkeeping 3.0.12

Product Releases: 
* ARC Infosys 1.0.0, 
* STORM 1.7.0

Note: ARC Infosys and STORM should be installed from scratch since upgrades from previous versions are <i>not supported</i>.

item.description: UMD 1.0.0 is the first release of UMD-1 (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This initial release will contain only the most critical products from EGI's Technology Providers as agreed by the TCB (Technology Coordination Board) on behalf of the EGI community.
item.releaseNotes: This is the first release of the UMD-1 that is made available for EGI's production infrastructure.  <ul><li>All products in the UMD 1.0.0 release were verified against EGI's current Quality Criteria (for further information, please see the documentation links) to support 64bit Scientific Linux 5 (x86_64 processor architecture).&nbsp;</li><li>Installation notes and known issues are collected on a per-product bases, and are available in the <a href="https://wiki.egi.eu/wiki/UMD-1:UMD-1.0.0">EGI Wiki</a>. When browsing the EGI Repository, each product available in this release will provide a link to the respective entry in the mentioned Wiki space, providing specific information about any issues discovered during Verification and/or StagedRollout.&nbsp;</li></ul>For more information on EGI's Software Provisioning process, see <a href="http://go.egi.eu/68">MS503</a> and <a href="http://go.egi.eu/53">MS402</a>.
item.installationNotes: As this is the first release of UMD-1, and uses a different structure than previous releases of these products, each product <b>must</b> be installed from scratch as in-place updates are not supported. Please consult the product specific installation instructions provided by EMI, the Technology Provider delivering the components in this release.&nbsp;Additional installation notes are collected on a per-product bases, and are available in the <a href="https://wiki.egi.eu/wiki/UMD-1:UMD-1.0.0">EGI Wiki</a>.
item.contact: For further information about the UMD, its goals and surrounding processes, and more information about how to engage as a Technology Provider with EGI, please send an Email to: cto (at) egi.eu.
item.technicalContact: For any bugs and issues you encounter that are not described in the release notes of this UMD release, or the related documentation provided by the Technology Providers, please visit the <a href="https://ggus.eu/pages/home.php">EGI Helpdesk</a> to make a report.
item.knownIssues: Known issues are collected on a per-product bases, and are available in the <a href="https://wiki.egi.eu/wiki/UMD-1:UMD-1.0.0"> EGI Wiki</a>.
